text: Robert Arthur Moog ( ; May 23, 1934 – August 21, 2005) was an American engineer. He was born in New York City. He was known for his works with electronic music. He was the founder of Moog Music and the inventor of the first commercial synthesizer, the Moog synthesizer. Moog died in Asheville, North Carolina on August 21, 2005 from glioblastoma, a rare form of brain cancer, aged 71. ==References== ==Other websites== * Moog Music — official website * The Bob Moog Memorial Foundation for Electronic Music * Robert Moog discography at Discogs Category:1934 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Deaths from glioblastoma Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:American electronic engineers
title: Robert Moog
